VideoOverlay.onPeriod

Function/Meaning
A Period event occurred
Type
Event of the VideoOverlay class
Syntax
onPeriod(type)
Arguments
type Represents the type of the Period event.
It is one of the following:
perLoop : Reached the end of a (normal) loop
perSegLoop : Reached the end of a segment loop
perPeriod : Reached the frame specified by the setPeriodEvent method
perPrepare : Playback preparation by the prepare method is complete
Description
This method is called when the end of a loop is reached, when a frame specified by setPeriodEvent is reached, or when playback preparation is completed by the prepare method.
When this event is called because the end of a loop or a frame specified by setPeriodEvent has been reached, the playback position may already have passed the specified position depending on the playback status. Refer to the frame property to get the current actual playback position.
Reference
VideoOverlay.setPeriodEvent
VideoOverlay.prepare
VideoOverlay.frame
